creditline: Gift of Elizabeth and Lloyd Olson
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Cloth, 1920-1940, cotton and silk, openwork, fringed border. Woven in Totonicopan for use in Quetzaltenango. Called a "mouth wiping cloth" for use by Cofradia. Called a Subalchi.
title: Cloth (Subalchi)
